thread.title: After his own screwup, Mickelson taunts Day and Scott
thread.title_full: After his own screwup, Mickelson taunts Day and Scott

author: Chris Chase
title: After his own screwup, Mickelson taunts Day and Scott
text:
After his own screwup, Mickelson taunts Day and Scott USA Today Sports 9 hrs ago Chris Chase © Photo by Chung Sung-Jun/Getty Images INCHEON CITY, SOUTH KOREA - OCTOBER 09: Phil Mickelson of the United States Team confers with his caddie Jim Mackay as rules offical Gary Young looks on during the Friday four-ball matches at The Presidents Cup at Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea on October 9, 2015 in Songdo IBD, Incheon City, South Korea Yes, there were some problems with the way Phil Mickelson’s rules violation at the President’s Cup was handled . But at the end of the day, it was still his fault. He (or his caddy, who are one and the same) had different golf balls in Mickelson’s golf bag, a violation which, at the very least, would have cost his team one hole and ended up costing it two holes, in a match split with Jason Day and Adam Scott. So, obviously, Mickelson was contrite about the whole thing in his post-round press conference. Either that, or he just threw down the gauntlet and basically invited the International team to a steel-cage match, golf-style.
AdChoices
#FIGJAM pic.twitter.com/pLy5UTrN8w
— Brendan Porath (@BrendanPorath) October 9, 2015
Just a huge, huge bravo to Phil. The half-grin, right as he realizes what he’s about to say, is classic. I love it. You messed up. You’re the reason why your entire team leads by one point instead of two points, yet you’re still talking trash. Who says golf is too dull?
